basics.name: Artem Avetisyan
basics.label: Senior Web Developer
basics.summary: Experienced fullstack web developer with over 15 years of hands-on experience in crafting web applications, specializing in Ruby on Rails and Node.js.

work.summary: At this London-based consultancy, I worked on various client projects, developing high quality server and client side code.
highlights: Worked on greenfield projects and legacy system replacements, utilising a diverse tech stack from Node.js to Rails.
Gained insights into various industries through diverse projects, which improved my problem-solving approach.
Worked both solo and as a part of client team, sharing my expertise, and coaching when necessary.
Took on devops tasks when necessary.
Contributed to open source, wrote blog posts, and spoke at tech events.

work.summary: Helped various teams with product and infrastructure development.
highlights: Upgraded the main FC Rails app to modern version of ruby (which was previously deemed too hard).
Developed a way to run the entire FC stack locally, thus boosting productivity across the entire tech department.
Worked on ETL side of FC app integration with Salesforce.

work.summary: A greenfield project to build a mobile operator store site for their launch in the US.
Worked as a part of small agile team on various aspects of the site: searching for places, booking places, landlord onboarding, admin backend and more.
highlights: Worked in a very fast paced startup environment, often working on multiple things at a time.

work.summary: Building tech for a disruptive startup.
highlights: Worked both solo and as a part of a team.
Quickly pivoting as the business was actively looking for a winning strategy.

work.summary: Helped BBC Future Media teams to integrate TDD/BDD into their projects.
highlights: Worked closely with product owners to define software specs
Developed a testing tool - RestAssured - that is still in use in the BBC.

work.summary: Mainly Perl web development and a few small Rails contracts.

projects.name: TransOver
projects.description: Super slim and minimalistic translator browser extension. 100K+ Chrome and Firefox users.

projects.name: StarLogs
projects.description: A fun github log viewer, styled as a Star Wars crawl. Brought me to the top of Hackernews.

projects.name: The smallest Rails app
projects.description: The smallest Rails app in the World.

projects.name: Tmux Super Fingers
projects.description: Tmux plugin to open file links in Vim
